block.p: On Saturday there will be a paella workshop from 3 to 4:30 p.m., followed an hour later by a suckling pig roast, at Breezy Hill Orchard and Cider Mill, 828 Centre Road, Staatsburg, N.Y. The class is $20, the dinner is $25 and a ticket for both is $35. The dinner is $10 for children 5 to 14. Reservations: (845) 266-3979.

On Saturday there will be a paella workshop from 3 to 4:30 p.m., followed an hour later by a suckling pig roast, at Breezy Hill Orchard and Cider Mill, 828 Centre Road, Staatsburg, N.Y. The class is $20, the dinner is $25 and a ticket for both is $35. The dinner is $10 for children 5 to 14. Reservations: (845) 266-3979.

A class in martini making, sponsored by the Learning Annex, will be held on Wednesday from 6:30 to 9:30 p.m. at the Sun Culinary Institute, 29 East 22nd Street. It will be conducted by Anistatia R. Miller and Jared M. Brown, the authors of ''Shaken Not Stirred: A Celebration of the Martini'' (Harper Perennial, 1997). The fee is $39 for one person, $69 a couple (course No. 0165NY): (212) 371-0280.

Heirloom vegetables will be on the menu at three events on Sept. 10. From noon to 4 p.m. there will be a tasting of 50 kinds of tomatoes and Tuscan dishes made with them at I Coppi, 432 East Ninth Street. The fee, $40, does not include beverages: (212) 254-2263.

At Wheatleigh in Lenox, Mass., at 2 p.m., dishes featuring tomatoes will be prepared by chefs from New York and New England, including Diane Forley, Michael Otsuka and Melissa Kelly. The event is sponsored by the Eastern Native Seed Conservancy in Great Barrington, Mass. Tickets are $35 in advance, $40 at the door. Reservations: (413) 229-8316.

And starting at 5 p.m., New York's Greenmarket program will hold a dinner featuring the markets' fare at Judson Grill, 152 West 52nd Street. It will be prepared by David Bouley, Peter Hoffman, Wayne Nish, Michael Romano and Bill Telepan. Tickets, $400, support the market's educational programs: (212) 477-3220.

Among the classes on the fall lineup at De Gustibus at Macy's is a two-session course on kosher cooking on Sept. 19 and 26, from 1 to 3:30 p.m. The cost is $150 for two classes, $80 for one (space permitting). There will also be a $95 white truffle class, including a tasting of dishes, on Nov. 2 from 5:30 to 8 p.m. It will be conducted by Pino Luongo, the owner of Tuscan Square, Coco Pazzo and Le Madri, and his executive chef, Marta Pulini. Reservations: (212) 439-1714.
